title: JWT Authenticated RPC not working via Websockets

### Description
I've tried to use engine and `eth` api space on authenticated RPC via Websockets and Besu responds with following errors on any requests: `{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":127,"error":{"code":-40100,"message":"Unauthorized"}}`. If I change it to `http://` on the same port, it works like a charm.

### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
I use following settings to enable RPC API in test:
```
      configMap.put("rpc-ws-enabled", true);
      configMap.put("rpc-ws-api", {"ETH,NET,WEB3,ENGINE"});
      configMap.put("engine-jwt-enabled", Boolean.TRUE);
      configMap.put("engine-jwt-secret", JWT_SECRET_FILE_PATH);

      configMap.put("host-allowlist", new String[] {"*"});
      configMap.put("engine-rpc-port", "8550");
      configMap.put("engine-host-allowlist", new String[] {"*"});
```

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
I could use Besu's `engine` and `eth` RPCs authenticated with JWT over Websockets

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
I'm getting `Unauthorized`

**Frequency:** [What percentage of the time does it occur?]
Always

### Versions (Add all that apply)
Besu 22.4.3

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)
My JWT key is `0xdcc12520e177f253b3ddc02d00cce05096441eef2c0d0b769d317511c29d894f`
